block.p: Harvest in the Square, a benefit for Union Square, will be held there tomorrow from 7:30 p.m. to 10 p.m. Dozens of neighborhood restaurants and food vendors will have booths. Tickets are $70 in advance from (212) 239-6200; $85 at the park.

Another harvest party, this one with a tomato theme, will be held on Saturday from 10:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden. It will include canning demonstrations, recipe contests and sales of produce grown by children. Admission is a donation of a can of food, which will go to City Harvest. Information: (718) 623-7200.

Afternoon teas 19th-century style, served with sweet and savory tidbits, are available every Thursday in September at 3 p.m. at Sunnyside, Washington Irving's home in Tarrytown, N.Y. Admission is $16 for members of Historic Hudson Valley, or $18 for nonmembers; it includes a tour of the house. Reservations: (914) 631-8200, extension 618.

The annual Dinearound Downtown, on the plaza of the World Trade Center, will be held on Tuesday from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m., with tastings from restaurants in Lower Manhattan. Tasting plates will be sold for $3 to $5. The rain date is Sept. 20.

Free tastings of Italian olive oils will be given at 6 p.m. on Sept. 22 and at noon and 3 p.m. on Sept. 23 at Buonitalia in the Chelsea Market, 75 Ninth Avenue (15th Street). Producers will be on hand to answer questions, and the oils will be sold at a 25 percent discount.

Actors will give readings of plays over lunch at the Producers' Club, 358 West 44th Street, from 1 to 2 p.m. every Monday, Tuesday and Thursday from Sept. 25 through Nov. 7. Blair Brown, Judith Ivey, Anne Meara and Cliff Robertson will be among the performers. Admission, $25, includes a box lunch. Reservations: (212) 362-2560.
